sourceMeaningMnemonic: When your <radical>scooter</radical> has a <radical>fault</radical>, you need to get an <kanji>alternate</kanji>. Hopefully your insurance will cover it too.
meaningInfo: You have a scooter that you drive every single day, but if you notice a fault, you need to send it in to get it fixed. That's when you break out your alternate scooter.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>alternate</kanji> scooter is made entirely of <ja><reading>鉄</reading></ja> (<ja>てつ</ja>). It's hard and cold and not very comfortable when you sit on it. That's why you chose to keep it as an alternate and not as your everyday scooter.
readingInfo: Imagine riding on your alternate <ja>鉄</ja> scooter. Feel the hard iron under your bum and the loud sounds it makes as you scoot down the street. I hope your normal scooter is fixed soon.
